title: I feel like I’m losing my grip
self_text: I (23F) have been struggling with depression and anxiety for years, but it’s been manageable with therapy and medication. Lately, though, things have been escalating. I lost my job a month ago, and I’m drowning in applications with no luck. My landlord is threatening eviction because I’m behind on rent. My friends are trying to be supportive, but I can tell they’re starting to get worn down by my negativity. I’m isolating myself more and more, skipping meals, and barely sleeping. I keep having these intrusive thoughts – not necessarily *suicidal*, but just…dark. Like, imagining terrible things happening to me or to the people I love. I’m terrified of spiraling out of control, but I don’t know how to stop it. I’ve scheduled an emergency appointment with my therapist, but it’s not for another week, and I don’t know if I can hold on until then. I just feel so utterly hopeless and lost.

title: I think my boyfriend is catfishing me
self_text: My boyfriend (22M) and I (21F) have been together for 6 months. We met online and have only video chatted a handful of times – he always has an excuse, like bad internet or being busy with work. Lately, I’ve noticed inconsistencies in his stories, and reverse image searching some of his photos leads to stock images or profiles with different names. I confronted him about it yesterday, and he got really defensive, accusing *me* of not trusting him. He said he’s just a private person and doesn’t like being photographed. But it feels like he’s avoiding me and hiding something. I'm starting to suspect he’s not who he says he is. What should I do?

title: Is it normal to feel disconnected from my fiancé?
self_text: My fiancé (29M) and I (27F) have been together for 5 years, engaged for 1.5. We generally get along really well and have built a comfortable life together. Lately though, I’ve been feeling…distant. Like we’re roommates who love each other, rather than partners deeply connected emotionally. We don’t argue, we still have sex, we spend time together – but it feels surface level. He’s been really stressed with work, and I’ve been focusing on my own career, so maybe that’s it? But I feel like we’ve stopped *really* talking, sharing our fears and dreams. It feels like we’re both just existing alongside each other, ticking boxes (dinner, movies, household chores) instead of actively nurturing our bond. I’m scared to bring it up because I don’t want to create conflict, and I don’t want him to feel like I’m blaming him for his stress. Is this a normal ebb and flow in a long term relationship, or is it a sign of something bigger? How do I gently broach this with him without sounding accusatory?

title: My husband expects me to handle ALL household tasks, even though I work full-time
self_text: My husband (32M) and I (30F) have been married for 5 years. I work full-time as a teacher, and he works part-time as a freelance graphic designer. Lately, I've been increasingly frustrated with the division of labor at home. I come home from work exhausted, but he expects me to do almost all of the cooking, cleaning, laundry, and grocery shopping. He argues that his job is more stressful and requires more creative energy, so he needs to conserve his energy. He also says that since he works from home, he's "always available" to help with things, but he rarely follows through. I’ve brought this up several times, explaining that I’m equally tired and stressed, and that a partnership involves sharing responsibilities. He dismisses my concerns, saying I’m being “unfair” and that he appreciates everything I do. Last night, I cooked dinner, cleaned the kitchen, did a load of laundry, and packed lunches for both of us – while he played video games. I finally snapped and told him it wasn’t acceptable. He accused me of attacking him and stormed off to bed. I’m at a loss. How do I get him to understand that I need help and that this isn’t a fair arrangement?

title: My boyfriend doesn’t want to workout?
self_text: i absolutely love my boyfriend and he means the world to me, i will love him and his body no matter what. the problem is he’s not happy with his body, he gained a couple pounds since we’ve been together and it’s really started to bother him. i myself am super into working out, i love it. i‘ve tried to get him to come with me on multiple occasions but it’s always “i’m too self conscious” “i’m tired from work” “my stomach hurts” “i’ll go tomorrow”. he’ll complain and complain about his body but does absolutely nothing to change it. when he says he’s going to the gym something always comes up, like today it was that he was too tired and he felt sick. again, i feel bad using him like this but I can’t stand him talking himself down when he is perfectly capable of hitting the gym a couple times a week and he knows this. should i stop trying to push him to workout and just listen to him complain?

title: My boyfriend doesn’t want to workout?

title: I think my boyfriend is catfishing me...
self_text: Okay, so I (23F) have been talking to this guy (25M) for about 3 months. We met on a gaming forum and bonded over our shared love of RPGs. We've FaceTimed a few times, but the quality is *always* terrible – he says it’s because of his internet. Lately, I’ve been noticing inconsistencies in his stories. Little things, like claiming he went to a concert that a mutual friend of ours said he definitely didn't attend. Also, he avoids sending pics of himself *at all*. If I ask, he’ll send a blurry selfie or one that’s clearly old. I did a reverse image search on one of the photos he sent me and… nothing. Literally zero results. I confronted him gently about it yesterday, and he flipped out, accusing me of not trusting him. He said I was being unreasonable and that I need to "get over" my insecurities. Now I'm freaking out. I really like him, but I'm starting to think he's not who he says he is. Should I push harder, or just cut my losses?

title: I think my landlord is illegally entering my apartment
self_text: I (24F) live in a rented apartment. My lease states my landlord needs 24 hours notice before entering my unit, except in cases of emergency. Lately, I've come home to find things subtly moved – a book shifted on the shelf, a blanket folded differently. Yesterday, I was showering and distinctly heard my key jingle in the lock, but whoever it was quickly left when I yelled. I haven't authorized anyone to enter. I'm really freaked out and feel like my privacy is being violated. Is this illegal? What steps should I take? I’m in California.

title: I think my landlord is illegally entering my apartment
self_text: My lease states my landlord needs 24 hours notice to enter my apartment, except in cases of emergency. Over the past month, he’s entered my apartment several times *without* any notice – once while I was home, and twice while I was at work (confirmed by Ring camera footage). He claims he's "checking on things" and "making sure everything is okay," but it feels invasive and unsettling. I’ve politely reminded him about the 24-hour notice clause, but he dismisses it, saying he owns the building and can enter whenever he wants. Is this illegal? What are my rights as a tenant? I’m in California.

title: I think my landlord is illegally entering my apartment
self_text: I (24F) live in an apartment in California. My lease states my landlord needs 24 hours notice before entering my unit, except in cases of emergency. Over the past month, I’ve come home to find items moved around, and yesterday I found a note saying someone had been in to “inspect the smoke detectors.” I hadn’t requested any maintenance, and I received no prior notification. I have a Ring camera inside facing the door (legal in CA, I checked!), and footage shows a man matching my landlord’s description entering with a key while I was at work. This has happened at least twice now. Is this illegal? What are my rights? I’m really creeped out and feel unsafe.

title: My fiancé keeps comparing me to his ex
self_text: My (27F) fiancé (29M) has been subtly comparing me to his ex (26F) for months now, and it’s really starting to affect my self-esteem. It started small – mentioning how she used to love a certain band that I don’t care for, or reminiscing about trips they took. Lately, it’s become more frequent and direct. Yesterday, he said I wasn’t as “spontaneous” as she was when I declined to go skydiving (I have a fear of heights!). Tonight, he commented on how his ex was a “really good cook” while I was serving dinner I spent hours preparing. He insists he doesn’t mean to hurt my feelings and that he’s just “sharing memories,” but it feels like he’s actively holding her up as a standard I can’t meet. I’ve tried talking to him about it calmly, explaining how it makes me feel inadequate and questioning whether he’s truly over her. He gets defensive, saying I’m being insecure and that I’m misinterpreting his words. I’m starting to wonder if I’m crazy for feeling this way. We’re supposed to be getting married in six months, and I’m seriously questioning if this is a sign of bigger problems. What should I do?

title: My Boyfriend Doesn’t Understand Boundaries
self_text: My boyfriend (23M) and I (22F) have been dating for about 8 months. Lately, he’s been repeatedly dismissing my boundaries. Specifically, I’ve told him several times that I need alone time to recharge, and I don’t want him to drop by unexpectedly. He insists that spontaneous visits are ‘romantic’ and that needing space means he’s done something wrong. Yesterday, I had a really stressful day at work and explicitly told him I was exhausted and wanted a quiet evening. He showed up at my apartment with pizza and insisted we watch a movie, ignoring my protests. When I finally got upset and told him he wasn’t respecting my needs, he accused me of being cold and uncaring. I’m starting to feel suffocated and like he doesn’t value my feelings. I’ve tried explaining calmly, but he always deflects or makes it about him. What should I do?

title: I think my boyfriend is secretly addicted to porn
self_text: My boyfriend (23M) and I (22F) have been together for almost 2 years. Lately, I've noticed some concerning behaviors. He spends a LOT of time on his phone in the bathroom, and always quickly minimizes the screen when I enter the room. He’s become less interested in intimacy with me, and when we *do* have sex, it feels…distant. I subtly checked his browsing history (I know, not ideal, but I was worried) and found several porn sites. He insists it's just "casual browsing" and that it doesn't mean anything, but it feels like he's minimizing it and deflecting. I'm not judging him for enjoying porn necessarily, but the secrecy and the decline in our physical intimacy are really bothering me. I'm scared to confront him directly because I don't want to accuse him unfairly or start a huge fight. What do I do?

title: I think my boyfriend is emotionally cheating
self_text: My boyfriend (24M) and I (23F) have been together for 2.5 years. Lately, he’s been spending *a lot* of time talking to a female coworker (25F). He says they’re just friends and bonded over shared hobbies, but it feels…off. He mentions her constantly, compares me to her (subtly, like “she’s really into hiking, that’s cool”), and lights up when talking about her accomplishments. He’s less affectionate with me, and seems distracted when we’re together. He defends her constantly, even when I haven’t accused her of anything. I brought it up gently, saying I felt insecure about how much he talks about her, and he got really defensive, accusing me of being controlling and not trusting him. He said I’m blowing things out of proportion. I checked his phone (I know, bad, but I was desperate) and saw a string of texts that were just…flirty banter. Nothing overtly sexual, but definitely playful and suggestive. He’s claiming it’s just their dynamic and she flirts with everyone. I feel heartbroken and betrayed, but I don’t know if I’m overreacting. Am I being unreasonable? Should I confront him again? I feel like I'm losing him.

title: Lost my cat yesterday
self_text: My indoor/outdoor cat, Leo, didn’t come home last night. He’s chipped and wearing a collar with tags, but I’m freaking out. He’s never stayed out overnight before. I’ve walked the neighborhood calling his name, checked under porches, and posted on Nextdoor. I keep refreshing the microchip website hoping someone scanned him. I feel terrible and helpless. He's my best friend. Any advice on what else I can do?

title: I think my landlord is illegally entering my apartment
self_text: I (25F) live in a rented apartment. My landlord (M, 50s) has entered my apartment several times without giving me any prior notice. The first time, I was home and he claimed he needed to check the smoke detectors. Fine, whatever. But then it happened *again*, a week later, and I wasn't home. My Ring camera showed him letting himself in with his key. Yesterday, it happened AGAIN. I confronted him via text and he said he was just "making sure everything was okay" because he hadn't seen me in a few days. I live alone. Isn't this illegal? I'm in California. What are my rights, and what should I do?

title: I feel like I'm ruining my partners life
self_text: My (24F) boyfriend (26M) and I have been together for almost 3 years. Things were amazing for the first 2 years, but the last 6ish months have been rough. I've been struggling with my mental health (depression & anxiety) and it's affecting everything. I'm withdrawn, irritable, and I've lost interest in things we used to do together. He's incredibly supportive and patient, but I can see it taking a toll on him. He's always making excuses for me to his friends and family, canceling plans because I'm not up to it, and generally adjusting his life around my struggles. I feel terrible. I know he loves me, but I'm starting to think I'm holding him back from living his life to the fullest. He's ambitious and has goals he wants to achieve, and I fear I'm dragging him down. I've been in therapy for a few months, but progress is slow. I keep thinking he'd be better off with someone who could match his energy and enthusiasm. I've brought this up to him a few times, suggesting maybe we should take a break, but he refuses. He says he's committed to us and wants to work through it together. I appreciate that, but it just makes me feel worse knowing he's sacrificing his happiness for me. I feel like I'm ruining his life. What do I do?

title: I think my landlord is illegally entering my apartment
self_text: I (26F) live in a rented apartment. My landlord has been entering my apartment without giving me any prior notice. This has happened several times over the past month – I’ve come home to find items moved, and once, the bedsheets were rearranged. I’ve politely asked him to notify me beforehand, citing tenant rights, but he dismisses it, saying he “needs to check on things.” I’m concerned about my safety and privacy. Is this illegal? What steps can I take to protect my rights? I live in California.

title: I’m convinced my boyfriend is catfishing me
self_text: Okay, so my boyfriend (23M) and I (22F) have been dating for about 6 months. We met online, which I know isn't ideal, but he seemed genuine. We've FaceTimed a handful of times, but he always has a reason why the quality is bad – “bad wifi,” “dim lighting,” etc. Lately, I've been noticing inconsistencies in his stories. Small things at first, like claiming he went to a restaurant that’s closed, or misremembering details about his friends. I did a reverse image search on one of the photos he sent me, and it popped up on a stock photo website labeled “attractive man smiling.” He freaked out when I confronted him about it, saying I was invading his privacy and accusing *me* of not trusting him. He then insisted it was just a picture he found online that resembled him. I’m starting to suspect he’s not who he says he is. I feel foolish for not catching this sooner. Should I confront him again, or just end things? I’m heartbroken even thinking about it, but I can’t handle being deceived.

title: I think my boyfriend is avoiding me
self_text: My boyfriend (23M) and I (22F) have been dating for almost 2 years. Lately, he's been really distant. He used to text me throughout the day, call me every evening, and make plans for the weekend. Now, he barely responds to my texts, avoids phone calls, and always has an excuse when I try to make plans. He says he's just been busy with work, but it feels like more than that. He used to be so affectionate and attentive, and now he seems withdrawn and uninterested. I confronted him about it yesterday, and he brushed it off, saying I was overreacting. I'm starting to feel insecure and worried that he's losing interest. I don't want to smother him, but I also don't want to ignore the fact that something is clearly wrong. What should I do?

title: My fiancé is refusing to elope
self_text: My (28F) fiancé (30M) and I have been together for 5 years and engaged for 2. We've always envisioned a small, intimate wedding – maybe 20-30 close friends and family. Lately, he’s been changing his tune. He wants a HUGE wedding – 150+ guests, fancy venue, professional photographer, DJ, the whole nine yards. He says his parents are subtly pressuring him, and he wants to “make them happy.” I’m a teacher and he’s a programmer, we’ve both been saving diligently for a down payment on a house, and a lavish wedding would wipe out our savings. I’ve tried explaining this to him, suggesting eloping and putting the money towards our future, but he flat-out refuses. He says eloping is “selfish” and that we “deserve a big celebration.” He accuses me of not understanding how important this is to him and his family. I feel like he's prioritizing pleasing his parents over our shared goals and my feelings. Am I being unreasonable to want to prioritize our financial future and a smaller, more meaningful ceremony?

He’s constantly mentioning her name, comparing her tastes to mine, and laughing about inside jokes I’m not privy to. He brushes it off when I say it bothers me, saying I’m being insecure and that they’re just friends. But he gets defensive *immediately*. Like, way more than he would if I brought up a normal disagreement. He's also started putting extra effort into his appearance – new clothes, cologne, working out more – which is great, but feels directed towards impressing *her*, not me. I’ve tried talking to him calmly about how it makes me feel, but he always turns it around and makes me feel like I’m the problem. I’m starting to feel really disconnected from him and questioning whether he’s developing feelings for her. Am I overreacting, or is this legitimate cause for concern?

title: Is it normal to feel empty after a breakup even if you initiated it?
self_text: I (24F) ended things with my boyfriend (26M) about a month ago. It wasn't a sudden decision, it had been brewing for a while – we just weren't compatible anymore and I knew deep down we wouldn't work long term. I was the one who initiated the breakup and I genuinely believed it was the right thing to do. Initially, I felt relieved and confident in my decision. But now, a month later, I just feel…empty. Like a hollow version of myself. I don't feel heartbroken or actively sad, just profoundly numb. I find myself staring blankly at the TV for hours, lacking motivation to do things I usually enjoy, and generally just feeling disconnected from everything. Is this normal? I feel silly for feeling this way since *I* was the one who ended it. Shouldn't I be feeling more empowered and less…void?

title: My landlord is threatening eviction over a cat
self_text: I (24F) rented an apartment 6 months ago. The lease *does not* mention pets – it’s completely silent on the issue. I adopted a rescue cat a month ago. My landlord (male, 60s) found out yesterday and is now claiming I violated the lease and is threatening eviction. He said “no animals are allowed, ever,” and that I’m breaching the contract. I’ve researched tenant laws in my state (California) and it appears since the lease is silent, he can’t retroactively enforce a no-pet policy. He’s also being generally unpleasant and accusatory, saying I “lied by omission.” I’m terrified of being evicted, even if I’m legally in the right. What steps should I take? Do I need a lawyer? I’m a student and frankly, don’t have a lot of disposable income.

title: I think my landlord is illegally entering my apartment
self_text: I live in California and my lease states my landlord needs 24 hours notice before entering my unit. Multiple times now, I’ve come home to find my landlord inside, seemingly just checking things. Yesterday, I arrived home to him *actively rearranging my furniture*. When I asked what he was doing, he said he was “making sure everything was tidy.” He did not give me any prior notice. I’ve politely asked him to respect the 24-hour notice rule, but he brushed it off, saying he “just wants to make sure everything is okay.” This feels like a blatant violation of my privacy and lease agreement. What are my rights and what steps can I take to protect myself?

title: I think my boyfriend is catfishing me
self_text: So I (22F) have been dating this guy (24M) for about 6 months now. We met online through a gaming community. We’ve video chatted a few times, but always when he says he’s at his parents’ house because his internet is bad at his place. He always angles the camera so I can’t really see much of the background. I asked to video chat again tonight, and he conveniently had a “family emergency” and couldn’t. I’m starting to think he’s not who he says he is. What should I do?

When I ask him what’s wrong, he says “nothing,” or “just stressed with work.” I believe him about the work stress, he *is* working long hours, but it feels like there's more to it. He still spends time with me, we still watch movies and go out with friends, but it feels performative, like he's checking boxes. He used to text me throughout the day, now it’s maybe one message if I initiate. I’ve tried gently probing, letting him know I miss feeling connected, but he shuts down or deflects. I’m starting to feel really insecure and unsure of where we stand. I don't want to smother him, but I also don't want to pretend everything is okay when it's clearly not. Has anyone experienced this? Any advice on how to approach this without escalating things into a huge fight?

title: I think my boyfriend is secretly addicted to porn
self_text: My (22F) boyfriend (24M) and I have been together for almost 2 years. Lately, I’ve noticed he’s been spending a *lot* more time on his phone, especially at night. Whenever I try to cuddle or watch something with him, he brushes it off saying he’s tired or has work to do. I accidentally glanced at his phone the other night (I know, bad, but I was suspicious) and saw he was watching porn. I didn’t say anything, just quietly put his phone down and went to sleep. It’s not the porn itself that bothers me as much as the secrecy and the way it seems to be consuming his time and attention. He used to be so present and affectionate, and now he seems distant and preoccupied. I'm worried he's developing an addiction and I don't know how to approach the conversation without sounding accusatory or judgmental. I want to be supportive, but I also need to protect my own emotional wellbeing. Any advice on how to navigate this?

title: Is it normal to feel lonely even *with* people around?
self_text: I have a decent social life – I hang out with friends regularly, I have a boyfriend, and I see my family often. But lately, I've been feeling incredibly lonely *despite* being surrounded by people. It's like I'm observing my life from the outside, rather than actively participating in it. I laugh when my friends laugh, I nod along to conversations, but I don't feel truly connected. I feel like nobody really *sees* me, or understands what's going on inside my head. Is this normal? Is there a difference between being alone and feeling lonely? And how do I fix it?

title: I feel like I'm drowning in loneliness
self_text: I just feel so utterly alone. I have a few acquaintances, but no real friends. I'm terrible at initiating conversations and even worse at keeping them going. Whenever I try to connect with people, I stumble over my words and end up retreating into myself. It feels like everyone else has these vibrant social lives, and I'm just watching from the sidelines. I'm 25, and it's getting harder and harder to cope with this emptiness. I crave genuine connection, but I don't know how to achieve it. I feel like I’m invisible.

title: I think my boyfriend is secretly addicted to porn
self_text: My (23F) boyfriend (25M) and I have been together for almost 2 years. Things have generally been good, but lately I’ve noticed some concerning behavior. He spends a *lot* of time on his phone, always claiming he’s “just browsing Reddit” or “catching up on news.” But the phone is always hidden when I enter the room, and he gets really defensive if I ask what he’s doing. Last night, I accidentally saw a history of incognito searches – all pornographic. I’m not prudish, and I don’t mind if he has occasional fantasies, but this felt excessive. He denies having a problem when I confronted him, saying it was “just curiosity” and that I’m overreacting. He’s also become less interested in intimacy with me, and I feel like he’s emotionally distant. I’m worried this is escalating into an addiction, and I don’t know how to handle it. I don't want to accuse him unfairly, but I also can't ignore this. What should I do?

title: I think my landlord is illegally entering my apartment
self_text: I (25F) live in an apartment in California. My lease states my landlord must give 24 hours notice before entering my unit, except in cases of emergency. Over the past month, I've noticed several instances where I've come home to find items moved, lights on that I distinctly remember turning off, and generally a feeling like someone has been inside while I was out. I installed a hidden camera (knowing this is legal in CA with certain restrictions which I’ve adhered to) and caught my landlord entering my apartment *without* any prior notification, and definitely not an emergency. He was just wandering around, looking at things. I confronted him via text and he claimed he was “checking on things” and that it was “no big deal.” This feels like a violation of my privacy and illegal. What are my options? Should I seek legal counsel?

title: My boyfriend doesn’t want to workout?
self_text: i absolutely love my boyfriend and he means the world to me, i will love him and his body no matter what. the problem is he’s not happy with his body, he gained a couple pounds since we’ve been together and it’s really started to bother him. i myself am super into working out, i love it. i‘ve tried to get him to come with me on multiple occasions but it’s always “i’m too self conscious” “i’m tired from work” “my stomach hurts” “i’ll go tomorrow”. he’ll complain and complain about his body but does absolutely nothing to change it. when he says he’s going to the gym something always comes up, like today it was that he was too tired and he felt sick. again, i feel bad using the term ‘sick’, he just said he wasn’t feeling up to it. I can’t stand him talking himself down when he is perfectly capable of hitting the gym a couple times a week and he knows this. should i stop trying to push him to workout and just listen to him complain?

title: I think my boyfriend is cheating on me but I don’t know how to confront him
self_text: Okay so I (23F) have been with my boyfriend (24M) for almost 2 years. Things have been good overall, but lately I've been feeling uneasy. He’s been working a lot more, which is fine, I support his career goals. But he's also been *super* secretive about his phone – always facing down, changing screens when I enter the room, and deleting messages. He used to leave it unlocked all the time, now it’s password protected. Also, he’s been complimenting my appearance a lot more lately, which sounds weird to say, but it feels…off? Like he’s trying to reassure himself I still find him attractive? I found a suspicious charge on our shared credit card for a restaurant I know he never goes to, and when I asked he brushed it off saying it was a work dinner. I'm struggling with anxiety and I'm overthinking everything. I really don't want to accuse him of something without proof, but my gut is screaming at me. I don’t want to seem controlling or distrustful. How do I bring this up to him without starting a huge fight or ruining our relationship if he’s actually innocent?

title: I think my landlord is illegally entering my apartment
self_text: I (24F) live in an apartment in California. My lease states my landlord needs 24 hours notice before entering my unit. I confronted him via text, politely reminding him of the 24-hour notice clause, and he responded with a vague “sometimes I need to check on things.” What are my rights? Is this illegal? What steps should I take? I'm scared to escalate things, but also feel deeply violated.

Tonight, I accidentally saw a text notification pop up on his phone from a number I don’t recognize. I feel like he’s lying, and I don’t know what to do. I’m heartbroken and confused. Should I confront him again? Try to find out who the number belongs to? Or just end things?

title: I think my landlord is illegally entering my apartment

Once, he claimed he was "checking the smoke detectors," but it was odd because he was fiddling with my thermostat. Another time, my cat was visibly shaken and hiding, suggesting someone had been in while I was at work. I've politely brought this up to him, but he brushes it off saying he "has a key for emergencies" and implies I'm being unreasonable. Is this illegal? I'm in California. What steps can I take to protect my privacy and ensure he stops entering my apartment without permission?

title: Lost a friend over politics
self_text: My (23F) longtime friend (23M) and I have always had differing political views, but we’ve always been able to respectfully disagree. Lately, though, he’s become increasingly radicalized and vocal about his beliefs online – specifically, sharing misinformation and hateful rhetoric. I politely challenged him on a few posts, pointing out inaccuracies and harmful implications. He accused me of being “brainwashed” and “woke,” and doubled down on his views. Things escalated quickly, culminating in a heated argument where he essentially dismissed my concerns and insisted I was deliberately misunderstanding him. I told him I needed space and unfollowed him on social media. He then texted me a lengthy rant accusing me of ruining our friendship because I couldn’t accept his “truth.” I’ve tried to explain that it’s not about accepting his views, but about his willingness to spread harmful disinformation and his refusal to engage in respectful dialogue. He’s not budging. I’m heartbroken, but I also feel relieved to distance myself from someone who holds such divisive beliefs. Was I wrong to prioritize my values and end the friendship? I miss him, but I don’t know if this is salvageable.

title: I think my boyfriend is secretly addicted to porn
self_text: My (22F) boyfriend (23M) and I have been together for almost two years. Lately, I’ve noticed some concerning behaviour. He spends a LOT of time on his phone in the evenings, ostensibly ‘gaming’, but the screen is often dimmed and angled away from me. I’ve casually asked what he’s playing, and his answers are vague or he changes the subject. Once, I accidentally glanced at his phone while he was in the shower and saw a history of incognito browsing – several porn sites. He denied it when I confronted him, claiming his phone must have been unlocked and someone else used it (we live alone!). I’m finding it increasingly difficult to trust him and it's impacting our intimacy. I don’t want to accuse him outright without concrete proof, but I’m worried about a potential addiction. Should I confront him again, or try to subtly gather more information? How do I navigate this situation without damaging our relationship further?

title: I just found out my boyfriend has a secret TikTok account
self_text: My boyfriend (23M) and I (22F) have been together for almost 2 years. He doesn’t really use social media – he has a Facebook he barely touches and an Instagram he only uses to look at memes. I’m pretty active on TikTok and follow a lot of creators. Tonight I was looking through the ‘suggested accounts’ section and stumbled upon a profile that looked *suspiciously* familiar. Turns out it was him. He has a whole other TikTok account with videos of him dancing, lip-syncing, and generally goofing around – stuff he’d NEVER do around me. It’s not overtly sexual or anything, but it’s definitely a side of him I’ve never seen and he’s actively hidden from me. I feel hurt and betrayed that he felt the need to create a secret account. I confronted him and he got defensive, saying he just wanted a space to be silly without feeling judged. But it feels like he was judging *me*. AITA for being upset? Is this a bigger deal than I’m making it out to be?

title: I think my boyfriend is emotionally unavailable
self_text: My boyfriend (26M) and I (24F) have been together for almost two years. Things were amazing at first, lots of deep conversations, sharing vulnerabilities, etc. Lately, though, it feels like he shuts down whenever I try to talk about anything remotely emotional. If I bring up a conflict or how I’m feeling, he gets quiet, changes the subject, or gives vague responses like “I don’t know” or “I’m fine.” He’s generally a lovely guy – kind, supportive, funny – but this emotional distance is really starting to bother me. I’ve tried explaining how it makes me feel, but he brushes it off or says I’m overreacting. I feel like I’m constantly walking on eggshells. I’m starting to wonder if he’s incapable of forming a truly intimate connection. Has anyone experienced this? How did you handle it? Is it something that can be fixed, or am I wasting my time?

title: My landlord is threatening eviction over a cat I didn’t bring in
self_text: I (26F) rented an apartment 6 months ago. My lease *specifically* states “no pets.” I signed it understanding this – I don’t have any pets and am allergic to cats. About a week ago, my landlord (M, 60s) sent me a notice claiming I violated the lease by having a cat, and initiating eviction proceedings. I immediately contacted him and told him this is a mistake – I do *not* have a cat. He insists he’s seen a cat entering my apartment several times. I’ve shown him security footage from the building entrance (doesn't cover my door directly) proving I haven’t been carrying a cat carrier or anything resembling one. I’ve asked neighbors, and none have reported hearing or seeing a cat in my unit. He continues to insist, suggesting it’s a “sneaky cat” and implying I’m lying. He’s refusing to drop the eviction notice. I'm terrified of losing my apartment over something I didn't do. I’ve documented everything, but what are my rights? Is there anything else I can do to prove I don't have a cat and fight this eviction?

title: Lost my dog yesterday
self_text: My sweet old man crossed the rainbow bridge yesterday. He was 15, blind, and deaf, and it was just his time. I knew it was coming, but it doesn’t make it any less painful. He was my best friend for so long, and the house feels so empty without him. I keep expecting to feel him nudge my leg or hear his paws clicking on the floor. I just…miss him so much.

title: I think my boyfriend is emotionally cheating
self_text: My (22F) boyfriend (24M) and I have been together for 2 years. Things have been generally good, but lately I've been getting a really bad feeling. He’s started spending a LOT of time talking to an old friend from high school, Sarah. They reconnect a few months ago and initially it was just catching up, which I was totally fine with. But it's escalated. He texts her constantly, like ALL the time. He’ll be sitting right next to me, scrolling through his phone and smiling, and when I ask who he’s talking to he gets defensive and vague. He says it’s “just Sarah.” He also started mentioning how she “gets” him in ways I don’t, and how they have so much in common. He brushes it off as just shared interests, but it stings. Yesterday, I accidentally saw a text from her saying “miss our late night talks,” and his response was just a laughing emoji. I confronted him about it, and he minimized it, saying I was overreacting and that I need to trust him. But it feels like he’s actively hiding things and prioritizing her attention. I don’t know if it’s technically cheating, but it *feels* like emotional infidelity. Am I crazy for feeling this way? What should I do?

title: I feel like I’m ruining my husbands life
self_text: My husband and I (both 32) have been married for 5 years. We’ve always been a team, supportive of each other’s goals. He’s a talented musician and has always dreamed of touring, but he’s always held back, prioritizing stability and a steady income (he works a desk job). I encouraged him to chase his passion, and recently he landed a gig touring with a band for several months. I’m thrilled for him, truly. But…I’m struggling. I work remotely and can technically work from anywhere, but I’m realizing I *need* routines and structure to function. Being alone for extended periods while he’s gone terrifies me. I’m prone to anxiety and depression, and I fear this will exacerbate those issues. I feel incredibly selfish admitting this, but I’m starting to resent him for pursuing his dream, even though I initially championed it. It feels like he’s abandoning me. I’ve tried communicating this, but he dismisses it, saying I should be happy for him and that I’m strong enough to handle it. I *want* to be happy for him, but I’m drowning in loneliness and fear. I feel like I pushed him toward something that’s ultimately destroying our happiness. Am I being unreasonable? How do I navigate this without crushing his dreams or completely falling apart myself?

title: Is it normal to feel jealous of your sibling’s happiness?
self_text: My brother (28M) just got engaged to a lovely woman and they seem incredibly happy. I’m genuinely happy *for* him, but I can’t shake this underlying feeling of jealousy. I’m 25F, single, and struggling to find my footing in life – career-wise, romantically, everything feels uncertain. Seeing him so settled and joyful makes me feel… inadequate. I feel terrible admitting this, but I keep comparing my life to theirs and it's making me miserable. Is this normal? How do I cope with these feelings and genuinely celebrate his happiness without feeling so down about my own situation?

title: I think my boyfriend is emotionally cheating on me
self_text: My (23F) boyfriend (25M) and I have been together for 2.5 years. Lately, he's been spending a LOT of time talking to an old female friend from high school. They reconnect via social media a few months ago and now they text nearly constantly, and he mentions her in almost every conversation. He says they're just catching up and reminiscing, but it feels…off. He'll laugh at her texts and show them to me, but then get defensive if I ask about them. Yesterday, I accidentally saw a text from her saying “miss our late night talks,” and he IMMEDIATELY snatched his phone away when he saw me looking. He insists it’s harmless, but he’s become increasingly secretive with his phone, and less affectionate with me. I feel like I’m walking on eggshells around him. I don’t know if I’m overreacting, but it feels like he’s developing emotional intimacy with someone else. I've tried talking to him calmly about my concerns, but he dismisses them and accuses me of being insecure. What should I do?

title: I think my boyfriend is cheating on me
self_text: My boyfriend (23M) and I (22F) have been together for almost 2 years. Things have been a little rocky lately, he’s been working a lot and we haven’t been spending much quality time together. Lately he’s been very protective of his phone, always locking it and turning the screen away when I’m around. He’s also been receiving a lot of late-night texts and calls that he dismisses as “work.” Tonight I accidentally saw a text pop up on his phone from an unknown number saying “Can’t wait to see you tomorrow 😉”. He immediately snatched the phone away and said it was a wrong number. I don’t know what to do, I feel like my gut is telling me something is wrong but I don’t want to jump to conclusions. Should I confront him? Try to investigate further? Or am I just being paranoid?

title: I think my boyfriend is emotionally unavailable
self_text: My boyfriend (26M) and I (24F) have been together for almost a year. Things were great initially, very passionate and exciting. Lately, I’ve noticed a pattern where he shuts down whenever I try to discuss anything remotely deep or vulnerable. Like, if I try to talk about my anxieties or a difficult day at work, he either changes the subject, minimizes my feelings ("it's not *that* bad"), or just gives me vague reassurance (“everything will be alright”). He’s fantastic at surface-level affection – cuddles, dates, watching movies – but when I try to connect on an emotional level, it’s like hitting a brick wall. I’ve tried communicating this to him directly, explaining that I need more than just physical intimacy, but he gets defensive and says he’s just “not good at feelings.” I’m starting to feel really lonely and disconnected, like I’m carrying all the emotional labor in the relationship. Is this something that can be fixed, or am I wasting my time trying to get him to open up?

title: My fiancé is obsessed with his ex
self_text: My fiancé (29M) and I (27F) have been together for 5 years and engaged for 2. Lately, I’ve noticed he talks about his ex *constantly*. It started subtly – mentioning a shared inside joke, reminiscing about a concert they went to. But it's escalating. He now brings her up several times a week, detailing things they did together, comparing our experiences to theirs, and even showing me pictures of her (claiming he “just found them”). He insists he’s not still in love with her, and says he enjoys our life together, but his obsession is making me feel insecure and unwanted. I’ve brought it up multiple times, explaining how hurtful it is, but he dismisses my concerns, saying I’m overreacting or that I shouldn’t be threatened by someone from his past. Tonight, he spent over an hour talking about a gift he bought her for her birthday years ago. I walked out. I don’t know what to do anymore. Is this a red flag? Am I being unreasonable?

Is this grounds to break my lease? I'm really unsure how to proceed.
